result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prostitution-Nonmmarital Sexual Intercourse, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentences defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court will waive all mandatory and non-mandaorty fees, costs and surcharges due to the 2 days time served.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of constitutional rights and of maximum penalties, waived all rights and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by state and defense to complaint as factual basis to sustain plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Both parties request an adjournment for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for projected guilty plea.  Parties request an adjourned date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Defense counsel is seeking a DPA resolution.  Court orders case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 45. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint discharge summary received and filed.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed:  missed office visit on 11-23-2015. 
Court takes no action and will address the matter on the next court date.
received from defendant, filed.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a scheduling conference.   Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 12/1/15 at noon in Room 504 of the Safety Building. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Case adjourned in branch 45.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant David A Lee in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services discharge summary received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE - COURT RECORD ENTRY IS MADE IN A DUPLICATE FILE.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant David A Lee in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1040 N 70th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53213
Received & Filed, Motion for Protective Order.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David A Lee in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant David A Lee in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

ADDRESS INFO for David A Lee
Current: 1040 N 70th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53213   (Effective: 09-03-2015)
Prior: 1557 North Farwell Avenue, Apt 109, Milwaukee, WI 53202
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant David A Lee not in court.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.vb
